miic.core.corr_fun.corr_trace_fun¶

corr_trace_fun(signals, comb=[], normal=True, parallel=True, processes=None)[source]¶

Correlate Traces according to the given combinations

The corr_trace_fun correlates the Traces contained in the passed Stream object according to the list of combinations tuple given in input. It does the job asynchronously instantiating as many process as cores available in the hosting machine. If traces do not share the same starttime the correlation trace is shifted by fractions of a sample such that time alignment is obtained precisely at the sample 1971-01-01T00:00:00Z. If there is no overlap between the traces this time might not be in the stream.

Parameters:
  • signals (Stream) – The container for the Traces that we want to correlate
  • comb (list, optional) – List of combinations that must be calculated
  • normal (bool, otional) – Normalization flag (See conv_traces() for details)
Pram parallel:

If the filtering will be run in parallel or not
Pram processes:

Number of processes to start (if None it will be equal to the number of cores available in the hosting machine)
Return type:

Stream
Returns:

corrData: The resulting object containing the correlation data and their meta-informations obtained as described in thr function conv_traces()
